content.body: hi all! just wanted to let you know that this year's State of JS survey is now open: https://survey.devographics.com/survey/state-of-js/2022

content.body:
littledan ljharb Richard Gibson: note that Date.parse is still evolving; see the link I shared in the ECMA-402 channel: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/v8/issues/detail?id=13494

Basically there is a web reality concern that Date.parse can round-trip Intl.DateTimeFormat at least in the en-US locale.
content.formatted_body: littledanljharbRichard Gibson: note that Date.parse is still evolving; see the link I shared in the ECMA-402 channel: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/v8/issues/detail?id=13494 Basically there is a web reality concern that Date.parse can round-trip Intl.DateTimeFormat at least in the en-US locale.

content.body: is there any intl way to see if the os prefers 24 hour time?
like if the user's locale is en-US but they want 24 hour time anyway
I think this is the "user preferences" proposal
